thread.title: H.S. football: Glen Rock edges Lyndhurst, 42-35
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Glen Rock edges Lyndhurst, 42-35

title: H.S. football: Glen Rock edges Lyndhurst, 42-35
text:
Print 
GLEN ROCK — When one quarterback is capable of making a football game a one-man show, the opposing team knows it has no choice but to stop him or be able to match his output. 
Despite giving up 331 rushing yards to Lyndhurst’s quarterback Peter Guerriero, Glen Rock’s junior duo of quarterback Matt Schlett and running back Ryan Dooner led the Panthers to a 42-35 senior day victory Saturday. 
"We knew no matter how many times we scored, they can come back one big play — that kid is amazing," Schlett said. "Give credit to my linemen, they give me all the time in the world when I need to pass, when I need to run." 
Schlett rushed for 101 yards and three touchdowns, all in the second half, on 21 carries and completed 11 of 12 passes for 148 yards and two TDs. Dooner added 155 yards and a score on 10 carries. Together, they posted 404 yards of total offense. Guerriero was 10-of-12 for 49 yards, a touchdown and two interceptions. 
"That was one of the single best performances I’ve ever seen at this level," Glen Rock coach Jim Kurz said. "[But] we had faith in our quarterback too." 
After trading scores through 2 1/2 quarters, Glen Rock recovered a fumble on the Golden Bears’ 29-yard-line and turned it into a score six plays later. Schlett faked a handoff to Dooner. Dooner went left, and Schlett cut to his right and went up the middle with the ball to put the Panthers on top for good, 28-21, with 4:29 remaining in the third quarter. 
Schlett said the Panthers have struggled to create big plays like the fumble recovery. 
"We were talking about defense. Coach said, ‘We need a big play, we haven’t had a big play yet and a big play is going to turn this thing around,’ " Schlett said. "They came out [of halftime], scored. … We are a bit low, then [the fumble recovery] brought us up, so that was big for momentum." 
The big plays continued as the Panther defense had two interceptions, and the offense added some breathing room before the Golden Bears rallied late. 
A 53-yard run by Dooner and a 19-yard pass from Schlett to Tommy Pulzello highlighted a five-play drive after Tim Ray picked off Guerriero. Schlett ran in the 7-yard score to make it 35-21 with 10:27 to go. 
However, the Golden Bears had Guerriero to make big plays for them. The senior matched Schlett’s three second-half touch downs, all on runs of at least 50 yards. Guerriero had a 53-yard score and then an 83-yard touchdown run to make it 42-35 with 47.5 seconds remaining. 
Lyndhurst recovered an onside kick, but Pulzello picked off Guerriero to end the game.
